DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Kitchen Air Purifier
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
    Filter Life
      Integer
      Range: 0-100
      Unit: %
  ***Accept Commands***
    Power On [PON]
    Power Off [POF]
    Set Fan Speed [SFS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Low [1]
          Medium [2]
          High [3]
    Reset Filter [RF]
    Query Status [QS]

USER QUERY:
Can you turn on the air purifier and set the fan speed to high? What is the current filter life percentage?

First, I identify the commands needed to fulfill the user's request. To turn on the air purifier, the device accepts the Power On command [PON]. To set the fan speed, the Set Fan Speed command [SFS] is used with a parameter indicating the speed level; here, 'High' corresponds to the enum value 3. The user also wants to know the current filter life, which is a property represented as an integer percentage from 0 to 100.

Step 1: Send the Power On [PON] command to turn the device on.
Step 2: Send the Set Fan Speed [SFS] command with parameter 'High' (3) to set the fan speed.
Step 3: Query the device status using Query Status [QS] to retrieve the current Filter Life property.

Result: Execute PON to power on, then SFS with parameter 3 to set fan speed to high, and finally QS to get the filter life percentage.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Living Room Smart Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Float
      Range: 5.0-35.0
      Unit: °C
    Target Temperature
      Float
      Range: 10.0-30.0
      Unit: °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [ST]
      Parameter 1: []
        Float
        Range: 10.0-30.0
        Unit: °C
    Set Mode [SM]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    Query Status [QS]

USER QUERY:
I want to set the thermostat to cool mode and lower the target temperature to 22 degrees Celsius. How do I do that?

The device supports changing the mode via the Set Mode [SM] command with an enum parameter, and setting the target temperature via Set Temperature [ST] with a float parameter in °C.

Step 1: Use Set Mode [SM] with parameter 'Cool' which corresponds to enum value 2.
Step 2: Use Set Temperature [ST] with parameter 22.0 °C, which is within the allowed range of 10.0 to 30.0 °C.

Result: Send SM with parameter 2 to switch to cool mode, then send ST with parameter 22.0 to set the target temperature to 22 °C.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Garage Door Controller
  ***Properties***
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
        Opening [2]
        Closing [3]
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OD]
    Close Door [CD]
    Lock Door [LD]
    Unlock Door [ULD]
    Query Status [QS]

USER QUERY:
Is the garage door currently locked? Also, please open the door if it is closed.

First, I need to determine the current Lock Status property to answer if the door is locked. The Lock Status can be either Locked [0] or Unlocked [1].

Step 1: Use Query Status [QS] to retrieve the current Lock Status and Door Status.
Step 2: If Lock Status is Locked [0], inform the user that the door is locked and cannot be opened until unlocked.
Step 3: If Lock Status is Unlocked [1] and Door Status is Closed [0], send the Open Door [OD] command to open the door.

Result: Query the status first. If unlocked and closed, send OD to open the door. Otherwise, report the lock status accordingly.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Bathroom Humidity Sensor
  ***Properties***
    Humidity Level
      Integer
      Range: 0-100
      Unit: %
    Battery Level
      Integer
      Range: 0-100
      Unit: %
  ***Accept Commands***
    Query Humidity [QH]
    Query Battery [QB]

USER QUERY:
What is the current humidity and battery level of the bathroom sensor?

The device has two properties: Humidity Level and Battery Level, both integers from 0 to 100 percent.

Step 1: Use Query Humidity [QH] to get the current humidity percentage.
Step 2: Use Query Battery [QB] to get the current battery percentage.

Result: Send QH to retrieve humidity level and QB to retrieve battery level, then report both values to the user.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Outdoor Smart Light
  ***Properties***
    Power State
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Brightness
      Integer
      Range: 0-100
      Unit: %
    Color Temperature
      Integer
      Range: 2700-6500
      Unit: K
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [TON]
    Turn Off [TOF]
    Set Brightness [SB]
      Parameter 1: []
        Integer
        Range: 0-100
        Unit: %
    Set Color Temperature [SCT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Integer
        Range: 2700-6500
        Unit: K
    Query Status [QS]

USER QUERY:
Please turn on the outdoor light, set brightness to 80%, and adjust the color temperature to 3000 Kelvin.

The device accepts Turn On [TON], Set Brightness [SB], and Set Color Temperature [SCT] commands.

Step 1: Send Turn On [TON] to power on the light.
Step 2: Send Set Brightness [SB] with parameter 80 to set brightness to 80% (within 0-100%).
Step 3: Send Set Color Temperature [SCT] with parameter 3000 to set color temperature to 3000 K (within 2700-6500 K).

Result: Execute TON, then SB(80), then SCT(3000) to fulfill the user's request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

    Target Temperature

      Range: 30.0-75.0
      Unit: °C
    Power Status

        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Power On [PON]
    Power Off [POF]
    Set Target Temperature [STT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Float
        Range: 30.0-75.0
        Unit: °C
    Query Status [QS]

USER QUERY:
Can you switch on the water heater and set the target temperature to 55 degrees Celsius?

The device supports Power On [PON] to switch on and Set Target Temperature [STT] with a float parameter between 30.0 and 75.0 °C.

Step 1: Send Power On [PON] to turn the water heater on.
Step 2: Send Set Target Temperature [STT] with parameter 55.0 °C, which is within the allowed range.

Result: Execute PON to power on, then STT with 55.0 to set the target temperature to 55 °C.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Energy Meter
  ***Properties***
    Current Power Usage
      Float
      Range: 0.0-10000.0
      Unit: W
    Total Energy Consumed
      Float
      Range: 0.0-100000.0
      Unit: kWh
  ***Accept Commands***
    Query Current Power [QCP]
    Query Total Energy [QTE]

USER QUERY:
What is the current power usage and total energy consumed by the smart meter?

The device provides two properties: Current Power Usage in watts (0.0-10000.0 W) and Total Energy Consumed in kilowatt-hours (0.0-100000.0 kWh).

Step 1: Use Query Current Power [QCP] to get the current power usage.
Step 2: Use Query Total Energy [QTE] to get the total energy consumed.

Result: Send QCP to retrieve current power usage and QTE to retrieve total energy consumed, then report both values.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Bedroom Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Low [25]
        Medium [75]
        High [100]
    Responding
      Enum
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    On [DON]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Low [25]
          Medium [75]
          High [100]
    Off [DOF]
    Fast Off [DFOF]
    Fast On [DFON]
    Query [QUERY]
    Beep [BEEP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
    Write Changes [WDU]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the bedroom fan to medium speed and confirm if it is responding?

The device accepts the On [DON] command with a parameter to set the speed: Off (0), Low (25), Medium (75), High (100). The Responding property indicates if the device is responsive (True [0] or False [1]).

Step 1: Send On [DON] with parameter Medium (75) to set the fan speed.
Step 2: Use Query [QUERY] to retrieve the Responding property.

Result: Execute DON(75) to set medium speed, then QUERY to check if Responding is True or False.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Irrigation Controller
  ***Properties***
    Water Flow Rate
      Float
      Range: 0.0-20.0
      Unit: L/min
    Schedule Status
      Enum
        Disabled [0]
        Enabled [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Irrigation [SI]
    Stop Irrigation [STI]
    Set Flow Rate [SFR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Float
        Range: 0.0-20.0
        Unit: L/min
    Enable Schedule [ES]
    Disable Schedule [DS]
    Query Status [QS]

USER QUERY:
Please enable the irrigation schedule and set the water flow rate to 15 liters per minute.

The device accepts Enable Schedule [ES] to enable the schedule and Set Flow Rate [SFR] with a float parameter between 0.0 and 20.0 L/min.

Step 1: Send Enable Schedule [ES] to enable the irrigation schedule.
Step 2: Send Set Flow Rate [SFR] with parameter 15.0 L/min, which is within the allowed range.

Result: Execute ES to enable schedule, then SFR(15.0) to set the flow rate to 15 L/min.
